Bead¶

class pyBrown.bead.Bead(coords, hydrodynamic_radius, label='XXX', hard_core_radius=None, epsilon_LJ=0.0, mobile=True, bead_id=None)¶

Bases: object

This is a class representing spherical beads used in Brownian and Stokesian dynamics simulations. First and foremost, it contains geometric parameters of the bead – the position of its center and its hydrodynamic radius. Apart from that, bead’s label (name) is present there as well. Finally, bead parametrization with respect to Lennard-Jones interaction potential is contained – Lennard-Jones energy and radius. Energy units are declared independently in input .json file.

Parameters

  • r (class: numpy.ndarray(3)) – cartesian coordinates of the bead center

  • a (float) – hydrodynamic radius

  • label (string) – bead label

  • mobile (bool) – switching on/off mobility of the bead

  • hard_core_radius (float) – Lennard-Jones radius: for two interacting particles the potential crosses \(0\) for separation equal to sum of their Lennard-Jones (hard core) radii.

  • epsilon_LJ (float) – Lennard-Jones energy: for two interacting particles the depth of the potential (in case of using both LJ6 and LJ12 terms) is equal to geometric mean of their Lennard-Jones energies.

Constructor method

Parameters

  • coords ([float, float, float]) – cartesian coordinates of the bead center

  • hydrodynamic_radius (float) – hydrodynamic radius

  • label (string) – bead label, defaults to “XXX”

  • hard_core_radius (float) – radius used in computing Lennard-Jones potential, defaults to hydrodynamic_radius

  • epsilon_LJ (float) – energy of Lennard-Jones interaction (for two beads interaction energy is a geometric mean of their Lennard-Jones energies), defaults to 0.0

  • mobile (bool) – switching on/off mobility of the bead, defaults to True

is_there_bond_between(bead)¶
keep_in_box(box_length)¶

Moves the bead into the box if it is outside of it by using a combination of translations parallel to the box sides and with length of a box length. Box’s interior lies between -box_length/2 and box_length/2.

Parameters

box_length (float) – simulation box length

translate(vector)¶

Moves a bead by the provided vector.

Parameters

vector (class: numpy.ndarray(3)) – translation vector

translate_and_return_flux(vector, normal, plane_point)¶

Moves a bead by the provided vector and returns flux through the provided plane. Plane is defined by its normal vector and any point lying on the plane. 1 is returned if particle goes through the plana in the direction of the normal vector, -1 if in the opposite direction and 0 if the particle does not go through the plane whatsoever.

Parameters

  • vector (class: numpy.ndarray(3)) – translation vector

  • normal – plane normal vector

  • plane_point (class: numpy.ndarray(3)) – any point in the plane

Returns

flux through the provided plane

Return type

int
